frameworks.name: The Prophet's Curse
frameworks.premise: A wandering holy man declares the king is cursed by God for excesses
narrative_hooks: A holy relic bleeds in the king's presence

frameworks.name: The Empty Granaries
frameworks.premise: Winter approaches and the people's stores are empty
narrative_hooks: Merchant tries to sell rotten grain
Last seed grain planted in royal gardens

frameworks.name: The General's Ultimatum
frameworks.premise: The army commander demands authority or threatens withdrawal
narrative_hooks: Secret letters between nobles and general

frameworks.name: Champion's Challenge
frameworks.premise: A foreign champion mocks the king's prowess in open court

frameworks.name: Colossal Statue
frameworks.premise: Artists propose a giant statue visible from every corner of the capital
narrative_hooks: Bird nests in crown cause plague

frameworks.name: Papal Bribe
frameworks.premise: The Pope's representative demands payment to overlook royal sins
narrative_hooks: Ledger of sins with price list discovered
Saint's relic turns out to be fake

frameworks.name: Book Burning
frameworks.premise: Radical texts circulate that question royal authority
narrative_hooks: Burned book ashes form prophetic message

frameworks.name: Assassination Investigation
frameworks.premise: An attempt on the king's life leaves few clues

frameworks.name: Famine Neglect
frameworks.premise: Reports of starvation in the provinces are dismissed as exaggeration
narrative_hooks: Child offers crown made of straw

frameworks.name: Church Confiscation
frameworks.premise: The treasury is empty, and the churches are full of gold
narrative_hooks: Altar found to be solid gold
Church mice are fat and healthy
Saint's statue weeps blood when touched

frameworks.name: Tribute Payment
frameworks.premise: A powerful neighbor demands tribute to avoid invasion

frameworks.name: Pyrrhic Victory
frameworks.premise: A glorious battle is won, but at terrible cost
narrative_hooks: Enemy leader's sword offered as tribute

frameworks.name: Plague Quarantine
frameworks.premise: A deadly disease spreads, forcing terrible choices
narrative_hooks: Cure exists but is too expensive

frameworks.name: Omen Interpretation
frameworks.premise: Strange signs in the sky terrify the population
narrative_hooks: Priest claims to speak with dead

frameworks.name: Heretical Research
frameworks.premise: A scholar makes discoveries that challenge church doctrine

frameworks.name: Machine Introduction
frameworks.premise: New technology threatens traditional craftsmen
narrative_hooks: Foreign spies try to steal plans

frameworks.name: Tax Reform
frameworks.premise: Peasants demand relief from crushing taxes

frameworks.name: Mass Execution
frameworks.premise: Rebellion leaders are captured and must be punished

frameworks.name: Succession Dispute
frameworks.premise: The king's heir challenges their authority

frameworks.name: Wrongful Conviction
frameworks.premise: Evidence emerges that an executed man was innocent

frameworks.name: Shipwreck
frameworks.premise: A treasure fleet is lost at sea
narrative_hooks: One ship survives with cursed treasure

frameworks.name: Miracle Site
frameworks.premise: A reported miracle draws thousands of pilgrims
narrative_hooks: Miracle stops when coins stop flowing

frameworks.name: Soldier Pay Raise
frameworks.premise: The army demands better pay or will mutiny

frameworks.name: Court Session
frameworks.premise: A day of tedious but necessary administrative hearings

frameworks.name: Government Paralysis
frameworks.premise: The bureaucracy grinds to a halt under conflicting orders
narrative_hooks: Official stamps run out of ink

frameworks.name: Sacred Schism
frameworks.premise: Two rival popes emerge, each demanding the king's allegiance

frameworks.name: Noble Extortion
frameworks.premise: Aristocrats hoard grain while cities starve
settings: Bread lines that stretch for miles
narrative_hooks: Count's dogs eat better than peasants
Noble's child caught stealing from own stores

frameworks.name: Silent Coup
frameworks.premise: The military takes control without a single sword drawn
narrative_hooks: Official orders appear without royal seal

frameworks.name: Dishonored Knight
frameworks.premise: A once-loyal knight publicly accuses the king of cowardice
narrative_hooks: Knight throws down gauntlet with own blood

frameworks.name: Living Tomb
frameworks.premise: The king orders a mausoleum so grand he wishes to occupy it while alive

frameworks.name: Sainthood for Sale
frameworks.premise: The church offers to canonize the king's ancestor for a price

frameworks.name: Whisper Network
frameworks.premise: Satirical drawings of the king appear mysteriously overnight
narrative_hooks: Censor's own face appears in cartoons

frameworks.name: Vanished Taxes
frameworks.premise: A year's worth of tax revenue disappears without record

frameworks.name: Burning Plague Pits
frameworks.premise: Mass graves from past plague begin to smolder and leak

frameworks.name: Pawned Crown Jewels
frameworks.premise: The royal regalia sits in a foreign moneylender's vault

frameworks.name: Hostage Prince
frameworks.premise: The heir must be sent to a rival court as guarantee
narrative_hooks: Ambassador's own child died as hostage

frameworks.name: Bridge of Heroes
frameworks.premise: A strategic bridge must be held against impossible odds
narrative_hooks: Captain's family lives on other side
Enemy offers safe passage for surrender

frameworks.name: Leper Colony Siege
frameworks.premise: A quarantined colony threatens to break out as they starve
characters: Merchant selling food at insane prices
narrative_hooks: Disease might not be leprosy after all

frameworks.name: Cursed Harvest
frameworks.premise: Crops wither and livestock die under mysterious signs
narrative_hooks: Ancient standing stones align with blight
Agronomist finds natural cause but too late

frameworks.name: Body Snatching Scandal
frameworks.premise: A royal physician needs corpses for anatomical study
narrative_hooks: Surgeon discovers cure but needs more bodies
Church has its own secret anatomy studies

frameworks.name: Clockwork Spies
frameworks.premise: New mechanical devices allow unprecedented surveillance
narrative_hooks: King hears his own plots repeated

frameworks.name: Common Law Revival
frameworks.premise: Peasants invoke ancient rights the crown has ignored for centuries
characters: Peasants armed with farming tools and parchment
narrative_hooks: Scroll bears royal ancestor's true seal

frameworks.name: Scorched Valley
frameworks.premise: A rebellious region must be made an example of
narrative_hooks: Rebels have royal hostage in mountains

frameworks.name: Madness in the Blood
frameworks.premise: The heir shows signs of the family's legendary insanity

frameworks.name: The Hanging Judge's Remorse
frameworks.premise: An aging executioner-judge confesses to wrongful executions
narrative_hooks: Families demand exhumation and proper burial

frameworks.name: Native Uprising
frameworks.premise: A distant colony revolts, cutting off vital resources
characters: Colonial governor's head in a box
Merchant whose fortune is tied up
settings: Map room with colony burning on chart
narrative_hooks: Colony was secretly losing money for years
Resource was about to run out anyway

frameworks.name: Forged Relics
frameworks.premise: The kingdom's most sacred relic is proven to be a fake

frameworks.name: Mercenary Integration
frameworks.premise: Foreign mercenaries demand citizenship and land
narrative_hooks: Mercenaries saved kingdom in past war

frameworks.name: Tax Assessment Tour
frameworks.premise: The king must personally witness the poverty he taxes
settings: Village with only old and young
narrative_hooks: Weaver was royal guard in youth
Child offers king a rotten turnip

frameworks.name: The Last Clerk
frameworks.premise: The final functioning bureaucrat asks what to do as systems fail
characters: Citizen with simple request amid chaos
narrative_hooks: Courier's message is 'what do we do?'
Citizen just wants a birth recorded as world ends

frameworks.name: The God-King's Decree
frameworks.premise: The king declares himself the living embodiment of the divine
narrative_hooks: Statues of gods remade with king's face
Natural disasters seen as divine displeasure

frameworks.name: The Debtors' Revolt
frameworks.premise: Those imprisoned for debt threaten mass breakout
narrative_hooks: Ancient law limits imprisonment for debt

frameworks.name: The Captain's Council
frameworks.premise: Mid-rank officers present a unified demand for reform

frameworks.name: The Poisoned Blade
frameworks.premise: A duel is interrupted when one weapon is found to be dishonorable
narrative_hooks: Both blades turn out to be poisoned

frameworks.name: The Sunken Palace
frameworks.premise: A floating palace is commissioned, defying nature and budget

frameworks.name: The Indulgence Mill
frameworks.premise: Forgiveness for sins is mass-produced and sold
characters: Peasant buying forgiveness for wrongs not yet committed
narrative_hooks: Indulgences for future sins sell best
Press breaks down on holy day

frameworks.name: The Royal Portrait
frameworks.premise: Artists compete to paint the king, but each version reveals uncomfortable truths
narrative_hooks: One painter shows the king's mortal illness
Hidden symbols in paintings predict fall

frameworks.name: The Counterfeit Coin
frameworks.premise: Perfect fake currency threatens to collapse the economy
settings: Secret workshop too good to find
narrative_hooks: Fakes are technically better than real coins

frameworks.name: The Collapsing Bridge
frameworks.premise: A vital bridge used by thousands decays until it fails
settings: River full of debris and bodies
narrative_hooks: Funds were used for palace decorations

frameworks.name: The Pawned Future
frameworks.premise: Taxes are collected years in advance
settings: Village with tax notice for 50 years hence
Empty fields as farmers give up
narrative_hooks: Tax collector's own future is pawned too
Child sold to pay parent's future taxes
Documents promise tax relief in afterlife

frameworks.name: The Open Gates
frameworks.premise: A city surrenders without siege to avoid destruction
narrative_hooks: Secret tunnel for last stand discovered too late
Enemy respects surrender and is merciful

frameworks.name: The Last Stand at the Pass
frameworks.premise: A small force holds a mountain pass against overwhelming numbers
narrative_hooks: Pass was abandoned by main army
Defenders are all that's left of a regiment

frameworks.name: The Burning Hospital
frameworks.premise: A plague hospital must be destroyed to contain outbreak
narrative_hooks: Doctor has immunity and could help
Some inside are not sick but caregivers

frameworks.name: The Speaking Stones
frameworks.premise: Ancient megaliths begin to whisper prophecies

frameworks.name: The Lightning Harnesser
frameworks.premise: A mad scientist claims to trap lightning in bottles
narrative_hooks: Assistant saw it work before accident

frameworks.name: The Mechanical Loom
frameworks.premise: A device weaves cloth ten times faster than human hands
narrative_hooks: Loom uses patented parts that break often
Guild has secret ancient weaving techniques
Inventor is actually a noble in disguise

frameworks.name: The Commoners' Charter
frameworks.premise: Peasants present a written list of rights they demand
characters: Peasant who can read and write
Lord whose ancestors granted similar rights
settings: Field where charter is read aloud
Royal court where it must be answered
narrative_hooks: King's seal needed makes it dangerous

frameworks.name: The Decimated Legion
frameworks.premise: Every tenth soldier in a mutinous unit is executed

frameworks.name: The Bastard's Claim
frameworks.premise: A royal illegitimate child appears with proof of lineage

frameworks.name: The Judge's Bribe
frameworks.premise: A judge is caught accepting money for favorable verdicts
narrative_hooks: Clerk has been documenting for years

frameworks.name: The Dried-Up Trade Route
frameworks.premise: A vital river for trade silts up or changes course

frameworks.name: The Holy Shroud
frameworks.premise: A cloth claiming to bear the image of a saint draws pilgrims

frameworks.name: The Standardized Bow
frameworks.premise: New military regulations demand uniform equipment soldiers can't afford
settings: Market where regulation markup is huge

frameworks.name: The Lost Archive Key
frameworks.premise: The one key to the tax records archive is missing
settings: Office where decision must be made without records
narrative_hooks: Archivist had secret copy but lost it too
Door must be broken, damaging history

frameworks.name: The Abandoned Throne
frameworks.premise: The last person at court asks who's in charge as kingdom fails
characters: Citizen wandering in looking for authority
settings: Gate with no one to guard it
narrative_hooks: Servant sits on throne as joke, is taken seriously
Guard remembers oath to 'throne' not person
Citizen just wants permission to bury dead

frameworks.name: The Silenced Bell
frameworks.premise: A church bell that has rung for centuries suddenly stops, seen as divine judgment
narrative_hooks: Bell cracked but no one struck it
Bell-ringer found dead with no marks
Other churches' bells stop in sequence

frameworks.name: The Orphan Army
frameworks.premise: Children whose parents died in royal wars beg at the palace gates
characters: Noble who profits from war contracts
narrative_hooks: Orphans sing song about the king's wars

frameworks.name: The Night of Long Knives
frameworks.premise: Officers quietly remove the king's loyalists while he sleeps
characters: Loyal guard discovering plot too late
settings: Map room where coup is planned
narrative_hooks: One loyalist was warned and hides

frameworks.name: The Tournament 'Accident'
frameworks.premise: A planned friendly match turns deadly suspiciously

frameworks.name: The Subterranean Palace
frameworks.premise: A vast underground complex is dug, destabilizing the city above

frameworks.name: The Sacred Lottery
frameworks.premise: Salvation is sold via randomized tickets with heavenly rewards
narrative_hooks: Peasant spends last coin on tickets

frameworks.name: The Royal Diary
frameworks.premise: The king's private journal is stolen and excerpts circulate
settings: Tavern where pages are read aloud

frameworks.name: The Disappearing Witness
frameworks.premise: The only person who can exonerate an accused noble vanishes

frameworks.name: The Unread Petition
frameworks.premise: A vital warning from the provinces sits unopened for months
characters: Official with stack of unread petitions
narrative_hooks: Messenger's body holds other vital messages

frameworks.name: The Royal Pawnshop
frameworks.premise: The crown jewels are offered as collateral for emergency loans
narrative_hooks: Foreign king offers to buy outright
Commoner recognizes family heirloom in collection

frameworks.name: The Unconditional Surrender
frameworks.premise: An enemy offers terms so harsh they guarantee future rebellion
narrative_hooks: Enemy knows it will cause revolt

frameworks.name: The Bridge of Swords
frameworks.premise: Soldiers use their own weapons to create a bridge over a chasm

frameworks.name: The Cordon of Fire
frameworks.premise: A ring of fire isolates an infected district
narrative_hooks: Some healthy trapped, some sick escape

frameworks.name: The Blood Moon Ritual
frameworks.premise: Astrologers demand sacrifices during lunar eclipse
narrative_hooks: Volunteer is secretly willing for reason
Astrologer's predictions have been right before

frameworks.name: The Forbidden Anatomy
frameworks.premise: A physician discovers fundamental truths by dissecting humans
narrative_hooks: Church has its own secret studies

frameworks.name: The Printing Press Heresy
frameworks.premise: Mass-produced books spread dangerous ideas faster than ever
settings: Print shop running day and night
narrative_hooks: Printer doesn't understand what he prints
Ideas spread to illiterate via readers

frameworks.name: The Farmers' Strike
frameworks.premise: Agricultural workers refuse to harvest until conditions improve

frameworks.name: The Mass Grave
frameworks.premise: Rebel prisoners are executed and buried in a single pit
narrative_hooks: Earth won't cover the bodies properly

frameworks.name: The Incestuous Alliance
frameworks.premise: A proposed marriage would unite dangerously close bloodlines

frameworks.name: The Recanted Confession
frameworks.premise: A man admits to crime under torture, then recants when sane

frameworks.name: The Native Uprising
frameworks.premise: Colonized people use their knowledge of land against colonists

frameworks.name: The Holy Water Monopoly
frameworks.premise: A spring declared miraculous is bought and access is sold
characters: Local priest cut out of profits

frameworks.name: The Uniform Rebellion
frameworks.premise: Soldiers refuse to wear new uniforms that are impractical

frameworks.name: The Annual Census
frameworks.premise: Counting the population reveals uncomfortable declines
narrative_hooks: Census taker threatened to change numbers

frameworks.name: The Last Tax Collector
frameworks.premise: The final functioning official collects taxes from starving people
narrative_hooks: No one at treasury to receive it

frameworks.name: The Inquisitor's Library
frameworks.premise: A secret library of forbidden knowledge is discovered in the palace basement
characters: Scholar who has been secretly studying
narrative_hooks: Library contains prophecies about current king
Inquisitor wants to burn it unread
Scholar has already copied dangerous texts

frameworks.name: The Winter Blankets
frameworks.premise: Royal storerooms are full of unused blankets while the poor freeze
narrative_hooks: Blankets are moth-eaten but still warm
Merchant bought them to drive up prices

frameworks.name: The Bloodless Takeover
frameworks.premise: The military assumes control during a royal illness, promising to return power

frameworks.name: The King's Proxy
frameworks.premise: A champion must fight for the king, but the opponent demands the king himself
characters: King who is a skilled fighter
settings: Armory where king dons armor secretly
narrative_hooks: Ancient law allows proxy but with shame

frameworks.name: The Celestial Clock
frameworks.premise: A giant clock that tracks stars is built, requiring constant royal funding

frameworks.name: The Bishop's Brothel
frameworks.premise: A high clergyman runs a brothel disguised as a convent

frameworks.name: The Royal Playwright
frameworks.premise: The court playwright's new work subtly criticizes the king

frameworks.name: The Poisoned Well
frameworks.premise: The royal water supply is tainted, and the culprit is unknown

frameworks.name: The Collapsing Mine
frameworks.premise: Reports of unsafe conditions in silver mines are ignored until collapse

frameworks.name: The Stolen Bell Metal
frameworks.premise: Church bells are melted down for coinage, outraging the faithful

frameworks.name: The Annual Humiliation
frameworks.premise: A powerful neighbor demands yearly ritual humiliation of the king

frameworks.name: The Cavalry Charge
frameworks.premise: A glorious cavalry charge wins the day but at terrible loss of horses and riders

frameworks.name: The Sealed Gate
frameworks.premise: A city gate is welded shut with sick inside
narrative_hooks: Some healthy are sealed in by mistake
Food is passed through small gaps

frameworks.name: The Oracle's Riddle
frameworks.premise: A mystic gives a cryptic prophecy that could mean anything

frameworks.name: The Lightning Rod
frameworks.premise: A device that attracts lightning saves a building but is called witchcraft
narrative_hooks: Inquisitor's church was struck by lightning

frameworks.name: The Spinning Jenny
frameworks.premise: A machine that spins multiple threads at once puts spinners out of work

frameworks.name: The Landless Laborers
frameworks.premise: Peasants whose land was enclosed demand compensation or land back

frameworks.name: The Night of Swords
frameworks.premise: Soldiers move through a rebellious town, killing anyone on the streets

frameworks.name: The Queen's Lover
frameworks.premise: The queen is discovered to have a lover, threatening the succession
settings: Nursery with heir of uncertain parentage

frameworks.name: The Sold Verdict
frameworks.premise: A judge is found to have auctioned his verdict to the highest bidder
narrative_hooks: Verdict was for a murder case

frameworks.name: The Sunken Treasure Fleet
frameworks.premise: A fleet carrying years of colonial treasure sinks in a storm

frameworks.name: The Indulgence Seller
frameworks.premise: A charismatic preacher sells forgiveness for sins with a money-back guarantee

frameworks.name: The Drilling Field
frameworks.premise: Endless drills and exercises break the army's spirit but improve skill
narrative_hooks: Sergeant is preparing for specific threat
Drills save lives in unexpected battle

frameworks.name: The Tax Auditor
frameworks.premise: A meticulous auditor finds irregularities in noble tax returns

frameworks.name: The Empty Treasury
frameworks.premise: The last gold coin is spent, and no one knows what to do next
narrative_hooks: Soldier offers to work for food
